body:
@NaeemKhan333 ah, several users have seen this error before, but I have not been able to reproduce. I've attached a new datasets.py file that can capture the variables that created this error that will help us debug it. Can you remove the .txt from the name, then replace the current datasets.py in utils/ with this one, and rerun your same code to reproduce the error, and then send the new output?

[datasets.py.txt](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/files/4495664/datasets.py.txt)

@glenn-jocher I have change dataset.py with this and run the code

Now the error is following

Namespace(accumulate=4, adam=False, batch_size=8, bucket='', cache_images=False, cfg='./cfg/myclass-spp.cfg', data='./data/myclasses.data', device='', epochs=300, evolve=False, img_size=[416], multi_scale=False, name='', nosave=False, notest=False, rect=True, resume=False, single_cls=False, weights='./weights/yolov3-spp-ultralytics.pt')
Using CUDA device0 _CudaDeviceProperties(name='Tesla K80', total_memory=11441MB)

     0/299     2.88G      6.66      5.16         0      11.8         8       416:   6% 37/591 [01:59<31:05,  3.37s/it](183, 416, 3) [192 448] False False True
(179, 416, 3) [192 448] False False True
     0/299     2.88G      6.71      5.15         0      11.9        10       416:   6% 38/591 [02:00<23:57,  2.60s/it]Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 424, in <module>
    train()  # train normally
  File "train.py", line 231, in train
    for i, (imgs, targets, paths, _) in pbar:  # batch -------------------------------------------------------------
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/tqdm/std.py", line 1091, in __iter__
    for obj in iterable:
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 345, in __next__
    data = self._next_data()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 856, in _next_data
    return self._process_data(data)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 881, in _process_data
    data.reraise()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch/_utils.py", line 394, in reraise
    raise self.exc_type(msg)
AssertionError: Caught AssertionError in DataLoader worker process 0.
Original Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/content/drive/My Drive/Colab Notebooks/New_Yolov3_Ultralytics/utils/datasets.py", line 633, in letterbox
    img = cv2.copyMakeBorder(img, top, bottom, left, right, cv2.BORDER_CONSTANT, value=color)  # add border
cv2.error: OpenCV(4.1.2) /io/opencv/modules/core/src/copy.cpp:1170: error: (-215:Assertion failed) top >= 0 && bottom >= 0 && left >= 0 && right >= 0 && _src.dims() <= 2 in function 'copyMakeBorder'


During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

@NaeemKhan333 ah perfect! Ok it looks like the function inputs that caused this error appeared twice. Now I can generate the same input here and hopefully reproduce, and then I should have this debugged today.

```
(180, 416, 3) [192 448] False False True
(183, 416, 3) [192 448] False False True
```

@NaeemKhan333 ok this should be fixed now in 693c06b26ca24f3cb24241ed3cf2a3cf03899341

Can you `git pull` and try again?

@glenn-jocher Thanks for your efforts, I have clone the repository and run the training code But Now I am getting this error 

fatal: not a git repository (or any parent up to mount point /content)
Stopping at filesystem boundary (GIT_DISCOVERY_ACROSS_FILESYSTEM not set).
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 7, in <module>
    import test  # import test.py to get mAP after each epoch
  File "/content/drive/My Drive/Colab Notebooks/yolov3_Recent/test.py", line 6, in <module>
    from models import *
  File "/content/drive/My Drive/Colab Notebooks/yolov3_Recent/models.py", line 2, in <module>
    from utils.layers import *
  File "/content/drive/My Drive/Colab Notebooks/yolov3_Recent/utils/layers.py", line 3, in <module>
    from utils.utils import *
  File "/content/drive/My Drive/Colab Notebooks/yolov3_Recent/utils/utils.py", line 23, in <module>
    s = subprocess.check_output('git status -uno', shell=True).decode('utf-8')
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/subprocess.py", line 356, in check_output
    **kwargs).stdout
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/subprocess.py", line 438, in run
    output=stdout, stderr=stderr)
subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command 'git status -uno' returned non-zero exit status 128.

@glenn-jocher The Code which I was using yesterday, cloned one week earlier. Now I have cloned the repository again and try to start the training But I got the above-mentioned error. It looks like the error related to Push which you have done 3 days earlier, please can you check it

@glenn-jocher I am using latest train.py and getting following error

Apex recommended for mixed precision and faster training: https://github.com/NVIDIA/apex
Namespace(accumulate=4, adam=False, batch_size=16, bucket='', cache_images=False, cfg='./cfg/myclass-spp.cfg', data='./data/myclasses.data', device='', epochs=300, evolve=False, img_size=[512], multi_scale=False, name='', nosave=False, notest=False, rect=True, resume=False, single_cls=False, weights='./weights/yolov3-spp-ultralytics.pt')
Using CUDA device0 _CudaDeviceProperties(name='Tesla T4', total_memory=15079MB)

2020-04-18 23:18:46.197603: I tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:44] Successfully opened dynamic library libcudart.so.10.1
Run 'tensorboard --logdir=runs' to view tensorboard at http://localhost:6006/
Model Summary: 225 layers, 6.25733e+07 parameters, 6.25733e+07 gradients

Using 2 dataloader workers

     Epoch   gpu_mem      GIoU       obj       cls     total   targets  img_size
  0% 0/296 [00:00<?, ?it/s]Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 430, in <module>
    train()  # train normally
  File "train.py", line 266, in train
    loss, loss_items = compute_loss(pred, targets, model)
  File "/content/drive/My Drive/Colab Notebooks/yolov3_Recent/utils/utils.py", line 378, in compute_loss
    tcls, tbox, indices, anchor_vec = build_targets(model, targets)
  File "/content/drive/My Drive/Colab Notebooks/yolov3_Recent/utils/utils.py", line 458, in build_targets
    gwh = t[:, 4:6] * ng
RuntimeError: expected device cuda:0 but got device cpu
  0% 0/296 [00:00<?, ?it/s]

> @glenn-jocher The Code which I was using yesterday, cloned one week earlier. Now I have cloned the repository again and try to start the training But I got the above-mentioned error. It looks like the error related to Push which you have done 3 days earlier, please can you check it

Yes this is related to a commit from a few days. The code is trying to check to see if it is up to date or not. I'll have to take a look at error handling on this better it seems. The second error is new, but I can't reproduce it. When I open up a colab notebook and start training everything works fine. You can copy this code block directly into Google Colab to start training correctly:

```bash
!git clone https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3
from yolov3.utils.google_utils import gdrive_download
gdrive_download('1h0Id-7GUyuAmyc9Pwo2c3IZ17uExPvOA','coco2017demos.zip')
%cd yolov3
!python3 train.py --data coco64.data --batch 16 --accum 1 --nosave --cache --weights '' --name from_scratch
```

Thanks, @glenn-jocher for your support, I have started the training using the previous code which I have clone last week. I have replaced the previous dataset.py with the recently updated dataset.py(committed today). The error get removed which I highlighted or raised tomorrow. Thanks

> @glenn-jocher Thanks for your efforts, I have clone the repository and run the training code But Now I am getting this error

> fatal: not a git repository (or any parent up to mount point /content)

@glenn-jocher Please look for this issue .Thanks
